content:
# Since the harvesting operation did not yield any results, it indicates that I may not have moved to the correct position or there might not be any Iron Ore available at the location.

# I will double-check the position of the nearest Iron Ore patch again to ensure I am targeting the right resource.
iron_ore_position = nearest(Resource.IronOre)
move_to(iron_ore_position)  # Move to the Iron Ore patch again.

# After moving, I will inspect the surroundings to confirm that I am indeed at a valid Iron Ore location.
assert inspect_inventory()[Prototype.IronOre] < 10, "Still not able to harvest Iron Ore." 

# If I still cannot harvest, I will consider looking for another resource type, like Copper Ore or Coal. 
# I will also check if I have the necessary tools or equipment to harvest resources. 
# If not, I may need to craft a basic mining drill first. 

# I will check my inventory again to see if I have the necessary items for crafting.
print(f'Inventory: {inspect_inventory()}')
